entry.title: S. F. Light (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that S. F. Light (pictured) disliked using his full name?

entry.title: Quinque compilationes antiquae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the second collection of decretals in the Quinque compilationes antiquae was actually compiled after the third collection?

entry.title: Tadeusz Gebethner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tadeusz Gebethner, a soccer player, bookseller, soldier and resistance fighter, was recognized as a Polish Righteous Among the Nations?

entry.title: Protector Shoal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that pumices erupted by the Protector Shoal volcano in 1962 floated to Australia and South America?

entry.title: Solar Wind Spectrometer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Apollo 12 Solar Wind Spectrometer detected a gas-ion shockwave produced by the impact of the Apollo 13 S-IVB stage on the lunar surface?

entry.title: 1855 territorial legislature elections (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the fraud that marred Kansas's 1855 territorial legislature elections led many to dub the elected body the "Bogus Legislature"?

entry.title: Bartow–Pell Mansion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New York City's Bartow–Pell Mansion became a museum after its operator was restricted from importing and exporting plants?

entry.title: sheep can get less stressed (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that sheep can get less stressed when looking at pictures of other sheep?
